view

Class WindowAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.WindowAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Window
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CraftWindowImpl, GameWindowImpl, InitialWindowImpl

    public abstract class WindowAbstract
extends java.lang.Object
implements Window
    An abstract class for the Window interface.Implements the Template-method design pattern. It provides the behavior and the initialization steps which are common to all windows and leaves abstract the createMainPanel() method which is responsible for the creation of the main panel and all of its components.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WindowAbstract(java.lang.String title, double heightToScreenSizeRatio, double widthToHeightRatio)
      Initializes the window providing the GuiComponentFactoryImpl component factory and creates the main frame with the given height-to-screen-size ratio and width-to-height ratio.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindowAbstract

        public WindowAbstract(java.lang.String title,
                      double heightToScreenSizeRatio,
                      double widthToHeightRatio)
        Initializes the window providing the GuiComponentFactoryImpl component factory and creates the main frame with the given height-to-screen-size ratio and width-to-height ratio. This is meant to be a basic template-initialization to be continued by the constructors of sub-classes (using super function).
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the frame
        heightToScreenSizeRatio - the height to screen size ratio
        widthToHeightRatio - the width to height ratio

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows the window, i.e sets the frame of the window visible. Can be overridden to add specific behavior before or after the showing action.
        Specified by:
        show in interface Window

      • hide

        public void hide()
        Hides the window, i.e. sets the frame of the window not visible. Can be overridden to add specific behavior before or after the hiding action.
        Specified by:
        hide in interface Window

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the window. Can be overridden to add specific behavior before or after the closing action.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Window
